content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    new_col = Vector{String}()
    for dt in df.dt
        push!(new_col, string(DateTime(dt).year * 100 + DateTime(dt).month))
    end
    return new_column = hcat(df, Symbol("ym" => new_col))
end
```

This function iterates over each element in the `dt` column of the DataFrame `df` and uses the built-in `DateTime` constructor to create a `DateTime` object from the string representation. It then extracts the year and month components using the multiplication operator to convert them into an integer representing the concatenation of the year and month. Finally, it creates a new vector of strings with the formatted data and concatenates it as a new column to the DataFrame using `hcat` (horizontal concatenation).
